channel.title: CNN.com - Europe
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Europe
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Social savvy to six-figure salary
Liu Wen's Paris survival guide
item.description: There's more to being a model than just looking pretty, according to Liu Wen. And she should know.

item.title: Man behind Kendall, Rihanna's style
item.description: He count's Kim Kardashian, Kendall and Rihanna among his "Balmain army" and he's not even 30 yet. Meet Olivier Rousteing, the fashion prodigy who merges hip hop with couture.

item.title: Karl Lagerfeld's unusual supermodel
item.description: When your owner is one of the most famous fashion designers in the world, the world is your oyster

item.title: The changing face of Chinese fashion
item.description: Vogue China's Angelica Cheung reflects on the evolution of the Chinese fashion market. CNN's Myleene Klass reports.

item.title: Chinese supermodel makes history
item.description: CNN's Myleene Klass meets Liu Wen -- the first Asian to crack Forbes' top 5 list of the world's highest-paid models.

item.title: Breeding kamikaze mosquitoes
item.description: The Aedes Aegypti mosquito is just two to three millimeters long but its impact is devastating. Of the thousands of mosquito species, this one bears primary responsibility for one of the world's deadliest and fastest growing diseases.

item.title: Incredible tech inspired by biology
item.description: When the body comes under attack by flu, dendritic cells rush to the site of infection and identify the alien forms attacking it. Millions raise the alarm and the immune system is fired into action.

item.title: A house made of sand and bacteria
item.description: Peter Trimble found his formula through trial and error. A design student at the University of Edinburgh, he was aiming to produce an artistic exhibition for a module on sustainability, when he stumbled on "Dupe," a living alternative to concrete.

item.title: What happens after you click 'buy'?
item.description: Say "Hello" to Betty-bot - the robotic organizer for in a warehouse about the size of four football fields.

item.title: Lost treasures reclaimed from wreck
item.description: In the azure waters off the rocky coast of Antikythera, a remote island in the Mediterranean with a population of less than 50, an international team of archaeologists has recovered new treasures from one of the most mysterious shipwrecks of all time.

item.title: Baking the perfect bike
item.description: They have two wheels, can weigh less than a kilo and more than 6 million of them are made each year. But how do you make the 'world's most aerodynamic bike'?

item.title: Can you guess her invention?
item.description: Some of humankind's greatest scientific discoveries have come from women.

item.title: Doorway to another dimension?
item.description: It may like a gateway across time and space crafted with alien technology, but in reality it's a fruit and vegetable market.

item.title: War: What is it good for?
item.description: The West is bombing terror group ISIS in Syria and Iraq, while Russia is engaged in a brittle stand-off in Eastern Ukraine. Bloodshed has dominated headlines through summer but, amid the misery, there is a winner: The defense industry.

item.title: Keeping Ebola away from humans
item.description: Much has been written about the many failures the ongoing Ebola crisis in West Africa represents: from the genuine lack of access to basic health care in many developing countries to the fact that the front line first response has largely fallen upon the brave volunteers of the nongovernmental sector.

item.title: Hero fights ISIS recruiters
item.description: His name is Abdullah X. His slogan: "Mind of a Scholar, Heart of a Warrior." But the star of this new animated show isn't a caped crusader battling bad guys in the streets of Gotham -- he's fighting for the hearts and minds of young Muslims everywhere.

item.title: Child with autism is an art genius
item.description: She is autistic and cannot speak. But her paintings are selling for thousands of dollars.

item.title: Could Ebola spread in Europe?
item.description: The news that a Spanish woman has contracted the Ebola virus has raised questions about what went wrong in the treatment of two patients evacuated from West Africa to Madrid, allowing the potentially deadly disease to spread from person-to-person outside Africa for the first time in this outbreak.

item.title: Russia celebrates Putin's birthday
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is riding a wave of popularity as he turns 62 on Tuesday. Michael Holmes reports.

item.title: Turkey: Take on ISIS or PKK?
item.description: Turkey is in a tough spot. It has ISIS militants threatening the Syrian border town of Kobani, inching ever closer to confronting Turkish security forces. In addition thousands of Syrian Kurds, fleeing ISIS attacks, have massed along its border, adding further to Ankara's troubles.

item.title: Eiffel Tower gets dizzying new floor
item.description: Mayor of Paris says 125-year-old landmark's new attraction will prove to critics that Paris still has some magic .

item.title: World's best auto museum?
item.description: Midlife crisis males have nothing on the Bugatti-obsessed brothers behind this vast sports car collection.

item.title: Thompson: Stop destroying earth
item.description: Oscar-winning actress Emma Thompson went to the Arctic to campaign against drilling in the area.

item.title: Albanian PM's brother 'controlled' drone
item.description: A drone flying a pro-Albanian flag over a major soccer game was controlled by the Albanian PM's brother, a Serbian official says.

item.title: Wozniacki: I dreamed I was dead
item.description: Caroline Wozniacki is known as one of the fittest players in tennis, but even the rejuvenated Dane is feeling anxious as she prepares to take part in the New York City Marathon in early November.

item.title: Going to London? Read this
item.description: Follow this guide and you'll leave London having impressed the clients, slept well, eaten better and brought home souvenirs people will actually keep.

item.title: Meet the 'zebra whisperer'
item.description: Ever thought zebras couldn't be tamed? Think again. Gary Witheford has a remarkable way with wild animals -- which he was forced to prove after a boozy boast in a pub.

item.title: Can a toy plane reach space?
item.description: A British team is set to launch a 3D-printed, rocket-powered space plane into the stratosphere. CNN's Jim Boulden report

item.title: Sudanese man dies of Ebola in Germany
item.description: A United Nations worker who was being treated for Ebola at a hospital in Germany has died.

item.title: Vatican backtracks on gay comments
item.description: Under furious assault from conservative Catholics, the Vatican backtracked Tuesday on its surprisingly positive assessment of gays and same-sex relationships.

item.title: President: No Catalonia independence referendum for now
item.description: Catalonia's November 9 independence referendum will not be held as planned due to the suspension of the vote by Spain's Constitutional Court, Catalan President Artur Mas announced Tuesday in Barcelona.

item.title: 'Mumbai-style' terror plot in UK
item.description: A man was accused Tuesday in a UK court of planning either an indiscriminate "Mumbai-style" attack or an attack against a prominent person, according to British media reports.

item.title: UK lawmakers vote to recognize Palestine as a state
item.description: UK lawmakers have voted in the House of Commons to recognize Palestine as a state "as a contribution to securing a negotiated two state solution."

item.title: Russia pulls troops from Ukraine border
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered 17,600 troops near the Ukrainian border to return to their bases, state-run media reports. RIA Novosti news agency says the troops' training exercises have ended.

item.title: 15-year-old Odegaard makes football history
item.description: Few 15-year-olds can claim to make history, but Martin Odegaard is fast accumulating a clutch of firsts in football.

item.title: Russia looks to China for business courtship
item.description: As its relationship with the West worsen, Russia is pivoting east in an attempt to secure business with China. Chinese premier Li Keqiang is in Moscow for a meeting with his Russian counterpart Dmitry Medvedev.
